content: title is my question? does it allow to do that and if not which hardware wallet allows me to do that?

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: Ledger live already supports a lot of ERC20 tokens. If they don't support the one you want,  you can add it manually by using MEW as explained here[1].The same thing applies to the Trezor wallet . It's possible to link your wallet with MetaMask and have full control over your tokens and also the networks you can connect to.[1] https://support.ledger.com/hc/en-us/articles/4404389645329-Manage-ERC20-tokens?docs=true

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: On a different note, Ledger supports around 2000 different coins and tokens. In reality, most of them are useless. I don't think there is another hardware wallet manufacturer that supports that many altcoins and shitcoins like Ledger does. Trezor has a fair share of them as well, but the support depends on the type of Trezor HW you have. If Ledger doesn't support it natively or through a 3rd-party app, is that really an asset worth buying and keeping? Just something worth thinking about.
